newsitem.title: USA: UAW's Ford council approves new labor pact.
newsitem.headline: UAW's Ford council approves new labor pact.

text.p: The United Auto Workers union said its National Ford Council unanimously approved a new labor agreement with Ford Motor Co on Wednesday, clearing the way for a ratification vote by the automaker's 105,000 UAW hourly workers.
UAW spokesman Karl Mantyla said voting by local unions may begin this weekend, and is expected to be completed by September 29.

Members of the 200-person council, made up of local leaders at Ford's 70 U.S. assembly and parts plants and other facilities, said they were pleased with the accord, which offers broad job guarantees and generous economic gains.
"It's the best agreement we've had since 1976 and we had to strike to get that," said Glenn Maxwell, a bargaining committee member at UAW Local 900 at Ford's truck plant in Wayne, Mich.
Workers said they were particularly happy with the wage increases, pension gains and $1,000-per-child allowance for college tuition assistance.
Bruce Click, from local 2000 in Avon Lake, Ohio, said he is not completely satisfied with all aspects of the deal, but added that "It's probably one of the best that we've gotten."
